data.enText: of king/queen
an object in the shape of a circle, usually made of gold and precious stones , that a king or queen wears on his or her head on official occasions
the government of a country, thought of as being represented by a king or queen
land owned by the Crown
a Minister of the Crown

data.chText: 谁将在此案中代表王国政府出庭？
data.enText: Who's appearing for the Crown (= bringing a criminal charge against sb on behalf of the state) in this case?
the position or power of a king or queen
She refused the crown (= refused to become queen) .

data.chText: 他拥有的获得法国王位的权利
data.enText: his claim to the French crown
of flowers/leaves
a circle of flowers, leaves, etc. that is worn on sb's head, sometimes as a sign of victory
in sports competition
the position of winning a sports competition

data.chText: 她决心卫冕她的温布尔登网球赛的冠军宝座。
data.enText: She is determined to retain her Wimbledon crown.
of head/hat
the top part of the head or a hat
highest part
the highest part of sth
the crown of a hill
on tooth
an artificial cover for a damaged tooth
shape

data.chText: 王冠状物（尤指饰物或徽章）
data.enText: anything in the shape of a crown , especially as a decoration or a badge
money

data.chText: 克朗（欧洲一些国家的货币单位）
data.enText: a unit of money in several European countries
Czech crowns

data.chText: 5先令的英国旧币（等于现在的25便士）
data.enText: an old British coin worth five shillings (= now 25p)
the jewel in the crown

data.chText: 王冠上的宝石；最有吸引力（或珍贵、有价值）的东西
data.enText: the most attractive or valuable part of sth
king/queen
to put a crown on the head of a new king or queen as a sign of royal power

data.chText: 伊丽莎白女王于1952年加冕。
data.enText: Queen Elizabeth was crowned in 1952.

data.chText: 王子不久就要被立为英国国王了。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: The prince was soon to be crowned King of England.
cover top
to form or cover the top of sth

data.chText: 他长了一头蓬乱的棕色鬈发。
data.enText: His head was crowned with a mop of brown curls.
make complete

data.chText: （尤指通过增添成就、成功等）使圆满，使完美
data.enText: to make sth complete or perfect, especially by adding an achievement, a success, etc.

data.chText: 荣获诺贝尔奖使其物理学研究的辉煌事业达到了顶点。
data.enText: The award of the Nobel Prize has crowned a glorious career in physics.

data.chText: 他们的努力终于取得圆满成功。
data.enText: Their efforts were finally crowned with success.
hit on head
to hit sb on the head
tooth
to put an artificial cover on a tooth

data.chText: 我的一颗牙齿镶了假齿冠。
data.enText: I've had one of my teeth crowned.
to crown it all

data.chText: （在一系列不愉快或讨厌的事件中）最糟糕的是
data.enText: used to say that sth is the final and worst event in a series of unpleasant or annoying events

data.chText: 天气寒冷又下着雨，最糟的是我们得走着回家。
data.enText: It was cold and raining, and, to crown it all, we had to walk home.

means: (尤指通过增添成就、成功等)使圆满，使完美

data.enText: the jewel in the crown

data.chText: 王冠上的宝石；最有吸引力（或珍贵、有价值）的东西
data.enText: the most attractive or valuable part of sth
to crown it all

data.chText: （在一系列不愉快或讨厌的事件中）最糟糕的是
data.enText: used to say that sth is the final and worst event in a series of unpleasant or annoying events

data.chText: 天气寒冷又下着雨，最糟的是我们得走着回家。
data.enText: It was cold and raining, and, to crown it all, we had to walk home.

tr: the part of a hat (the vertex) that covers the crown of the head
an ornamental jeweled headdress signifying sovereignty
a wreath or garland worn on the head to signify victory
the center of a cambered road
(dentistry) dental appliance consisting of an artificial crown for a broken or decayed tooth
example: tomorrow my dentist will fit me for a crown

tr: the part of a tooth above the gum that is covered with enamel
the award given to the champion
the top or extreme point of something (usually a mountain or hill)
example: the view from the peak was magnificent
they clambered to the tip of Monadnock
the region is a few molecules wide at the summit

tr: the upper branches and leaves of a tree or other plant

example: The prince was crowned in Westminster Abbey
A weather vane crowns the building

value.def: A crown is a circular ornament, usually made of gold and jewels, which a king or queen wears on their head at official ceremonies. You can also use crown to refer to anything circular that is worn on someone's head.
value.tran: 王冠;皇冠;冕;(戴在头上的)冠状物

value.def: The government of a country that has a king or queen is sometimes referred to as the Crown. In British criminal cases the prosecutor is the Crown .

example.ex: She says the sovereignty of the Crown must be preserved.
example.tran: 她说必须维护王国政府的主权。

value.tran: 王国政府;王国;(英国刑事案件中的)公诉人

value.def: When a king or queen is crowned, a crown is placed on their head as part of a ceremony in which they are officially made king or queen.

example.ex: Elizabeth was crowned in Westminster Abbey on 2 June 1953...
example.tran: 伊丽莎白于1953年6月2日在威斯敏斯特大教堂加冕。

example.ex: Two days later, Juan Carlos was crowned king.
example.tran: 两天后，胡安·卡洛斯被加冕为国王。

value.def: If one thing crowns another, it is on top of it.

example.ex: Here another rugged castle crowns the cliffs and crags.
example.tran: 这里又有一座高低不平的城堡建在悬崖绝壁之上。

example.ex: ...a very striking face, crowned by an abundance of hair.
example.tran: 一张非常标致的脸，长着一头浓密的头发

value.def: Your crown is the top part of your head, at the back.

example.ex: He laid his hand gently on the crown of her head.
example.tran: 他把手轻轻放在她的头顶上。

value.def: The crown of a hat is the part which covers the top of your head.
A crown was a British coin worth five shillings.
A crown is an artificial top piece fixed over a broken or decayed tooth.
In sport, winning an important competition is sometimes referred to as a crown .

example.ex: ...his dream of a fourth Wimbledon crown.
example.tran: 他梦想第四次获得温布尔登网球公开赛的冠军

value.def: An achievement or event that crowns something makes it perfect, successful, or complete.

example.ex: It is an important moment, crowning the efforts of the Cup organisers...
example.tran: 这是个重要时刻，它使得优胜杯赛组织者的努力圆满告捷。

example.ex: The summit was crowned by the signing of the historic START treaty.
example.tran: 此次峰会以签订具有历史性意义的《削减进攻性战略武器条约》宣告圆满成功。

value.def: If you crown your career with a success or achievement, you have a final success or achievement which is greater than all the others you have had.

example.ex: He went on to crown a distinguished career in radio and television with his book 'The Price of Victory'.
example.tran: 凭借《胜利的代价》一书，在广播和电视事业上成就杰出的他再创辉煌。
